definition: to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: Johnston said he recognised that taking the legal road would be hard.
sentences.chinese: 約翰斯頓說，他認識到，走法律的道路會很困難。

sentences.english: The Governor General welcomed Ambassador Zhang as the new Chinese Ambassador to Canada and wished him all the best in his tenure.
sentences.chinese: 約翰斯頓總督歡迎章大使履新，預祝他任內工作順利。

sentences.english: The stork visited the Johnstons yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 約翰斯頓家昨天添了一個孩子。
